intro: Cyphostemma uwanda, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by follicle fruits containing elongated seeds. Cyphostemma uwanda is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
